meanings.definition: To give orders or direction to others.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys bossing her younger brother around.
meanings.sent2: The manager is always bossing the employees to meet deadlines.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to be bossing the dog into sharing its bed.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was bossing the students like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The coach was bossing the players with precision and determination.

meanings.definition: The act of being in charge or in control.
meanings.sent1: His bossing of the situation impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: Her natural bossing made her a great leader.
meanings.sent3: The bossing of the project was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent4: The bossing of the team resembled a captain steering a ship.
meanings.sent5: The bossing of the company was evident in every decision made.

meanings.definition: A person who is in charge or has authority over others.
meanings.sent1: The bossing was fair and considerate towards the employees.
meanings.sent2: She was a strong bossing in the company.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended to be the bossing of her stuffed animals.
meanings.sent4: The bossing of the team was like a protective shield.
meanings.sent5: The bossing was respected by all for their wise decisions.
